oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Groundwater contamination due to salt-panning activity at Vasai-Palghar coastal zone, northern Mumbai, India
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHANDRASEKHARAM, D
SIRAZ, L
SHAH, SD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: maharashtra
vasai-palghar
groundwater quality
salt pan
saline water
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Groundwater quality has been assessed along the coastal zone of Vasai-Palghar, Maharashtra. Based on chemical mixing models and GIS based thematic maps, two saline groundwater zones have been identified. Br, I and Ci contents in the groundwater indicate that the low saline zone is due to the contamination by the high I-clays in the tidal flats while the high saline zone is due to the contamination by the brine form the salt pans.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Groundwater Research,COPENHAGEN, DENMARK,JUN 06-08, 2000
